revised_title: A Study of Botrytis Cinerea with Unpigmented Sclerotia
tldr: The author investigates the fungus Botrytis cinerea and discovers a strain with colorless sclerotia. They study the genetic relationship between this strain and other related species, concluding that Botrytis cinerea is not a developmental phase within the life-cycle of Sclerotinia. The author also discusses the possibility of genetic changes in the fungus and the importance of single-spore strains in understanding its behavior.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Fungal Genetics
